member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.ActualPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the current actual primary key of the data source. This may have been auto detected, if possible, or provided or overriden by the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.PropertiesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references for the properties desired by the consumer of the data source. If known, the data source may take steps to request only those properties, or to ensure that those properties are included, rather than the default behavior for this type of data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyUsingSourceIndexes
member.summary: Gets whether, when manually notifying the data source of changes, one should use indexes relative to the actual source data, or relative to the view the data source is maintaining into the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IsItemIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided item is supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IsKeyIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided primary key value is supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifySetItem(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been changed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the changed item.
The old item at the desginated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyClearItems
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that the data it has bound to has been cleared and needs to be re-examined. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyInsertItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been inserted in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the inserted item.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyRemoveItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been removed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the removed item.
The old item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.QueueAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to manually queue a refresh of the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.Refresh
member.summary: Called to synchronously refresh the data source.

member.summary: Gets the execution context that the data source should synchronize asynchronous actions with, or use to defer delayed actions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.ActualSchema
member.summary: Gets the resolved schema for the data source. Represents which properties are available for the items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.FirstVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets which index consumers of the data source desire to be the current first visible index. A grid, for example, would indicate the current visible top row, and update this as that changes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.LastVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets which index consumers of the data source desire to be the current last visible index. A grid, for example, would indicate the current visible top row, and update this as that changes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.IsVirtual
member.summary: Gets if the current data source is a virtual data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.IsSortingSupported
member.summary: Gets if sorting is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.SortDescriptions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add sort descriptions to. Changing the sort descriptions in this collection will adjust the sort applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.GroupDescriptions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add group descriptions to. Changing the group descriptions in this collection will adjust the grouping applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.IsFilteringSupported
member.summary: Gets if filtering is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.NotifyUsingSourceIndexes
member.summary: Gets whether, when manually notifying the data source of changes, one should use indexes relative to the actual source data, or relative to the view the data source is maintaining into the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.FilterExpressions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add filter expressions to. Changing the filter expressions in this collection will adjust the filter applied to the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.QueueAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to manually queue a refresh of the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.Refresh
member.summary: Called to synchronously refresh the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.ActualPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the current actual primary key of the data source. This may have been auto detected, if possible, or provided or overriden by the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.PropertiesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references for the properties desired by the consumer of the data source. If known, the data source may take steps to request only those properties, or to ensure that those properties are included, rather than the default behavior for this type of data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.Test
member.summary: Runs the built-in test suite.
member.returns: true if all tests pass

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearEvaluate(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluate the linear function y=a[0]+a[1]*x
member.param: function coefficients
function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearTest
member.summary: Tests linear fitting.
member.returns: true if tests pass.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LogarithmicFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the logarithmic least squares fit y=A+Blnx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN or the x is not positive, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting--Logarithmic." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFittingLogarithmic.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LogarithmicEvaluate(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluate the linear function y=a[0]+a[1]*ln(x)
member.param: function coefficients
function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LogarithmicTest
member.summary: Tests logarithmic fitting.
member.returns: true if tests pass.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.ExponentialFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the exponential least squares fit y=Ae^(Bx)
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN or the y is not positive, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting--Exponential." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFittingExponential.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.summary: Evaluate the function y=a[0]*e^(a[1]*x)

function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.summary: Tests exponential fitting.
member.returns: true if tests pass.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.IOverviewPlusDetailControl
member.summary: Interface for controls which can host the OverviewPlusDetailPane.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.IOverviewPlusDetailControl.ZoomTo100
member.summary: Zoom the IOverviewPlusDetailControl to 100%.
member.remarks: This method will be called when the OverviewPlusDetailPane's "Zoom to 100%" action is triggered, typically when the "Zoom to 100%" button is clicked. When this method is called, the IOverviewPlusDetailControl should zoom to a state which the user would recognize as "100% zoom."

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.IOverviewPlusDetailControl.ScaleToFit
member.summary: Scale the IOverviewPlusDetailControl to fit all its contents in view.
member.remarks: This method will be called when the OverviewPlusDetailPane's "Scale to Fit" action is triggered, typically when the "Scale to fit" button is clicked. When this method is called, the IOverviewPlusDetailControl should zoom so that all its contents are in view.

member.name: M:Infragistics.RectUtil.GetInflated(System.Windows.Rect,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Expands or shrinks the current rectangle by using the specified width and height amounts, in all directions. The size and position of the current rectangle are not changed.
member.remarks:
The Width of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified width offset, because it is applied to both the left and right sides of the rectangle. Likewise, the Height of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified height.
If the specified width or height shrink the rectangle by more than its current Width or Height—giving the rectangle a negative area—the rectangle becomes the Empty rectangle.
member.param: The source rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the left and right sides of the rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the top and bottom sides of the rectangle.
member.returns: Inflated rectangle.

member.name: T:Infragistics.StackPool`1
member.summary: Represents a pool of reusable objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.StackPool`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and returns an instance of a StackPool.

member.name: M:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Pop
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool.
member.remarks: The pool will either Create a new object or Activate one which was previously returned and Disactivated. If DeferDisactivate is set there may be pending active objects available which will be reused directly).
member.returns: An object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool for recycling.
member.remarks:
All references to objects which have been returned to the pool should be destroyed.
When an object is returned to the pool it will be immediately Disactivated (unless DeferDisactivate is set) and may also be Destroyed either immediately or some time later.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.DeferDisactivate
member.summary: Sets or gets the DeferDisactivate flag.
member.remarks:
When the pool is marked to defer disactivation, objects returned to the pool are not immediately disactivated, instead remaining in a limbo state where they are available for reuse without Activation. Resetting DeferDisactivate causes all of these limbo objects to be disactivated and potentially destroyed.
Deferred disactivation is useful where the activation/disactivation cycle is costle (such as add/remove a VisualElement from a ParentItem Panel).

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.ActiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of active items in the current StackPool object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.InactiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of inactive (not including limbo) items in the current StackPool object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to create new items.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to disactivate items.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to activate items.

member.summary: Specifies fastest interpolation that calculates average of all neighboring data points or defaults to zero if no neighboring points found in grid cell

member.summary: Specifies slower interpolation that uses Maximum of Closest Neighboring data point in grid cell

member.name: F:Infragistics.SurfaceGridDataInterpolation.InverseDistanceWeight
member.summary: Specifies slowest interpolation that calculates Inverse Distance Weight (IDW) of neighboring data points in grid cell

member.name: T:Infragistics.DataSplitMode
member.summary: Determines how to distribute data points if they fall between grid points

member.name: F:Infragistics.DataSplitMode.FullSplit
member.summary: Specifies full split of Z value to all grid points by distributing 100% of Z value to grid points

member.name: F:Infragistics.DataSplitMode.EvenSplit
member.summary: Specifies even split of Z value among each grid point by distributing portion of Z value to grid points

member.name: F:Infragistics.DataSplitMode.NoSplit
member.summary: Specifies no split of Z value between grid points by excluding data points that fall between grid points

member.name: T:Infragistics.SurfaceGridDistanceMeasure
member.summary: Determines type of measure used to calculate distance between points in the grid

member.name: F:Infragistics.SurfaceGridDistanceMeasure.CityBlock
member.summary: Represents fastest measure of distance calculated using sum of delta between X,Y coordinates. Same as measuring distance while walking around city blocks

member.name: F:Infragistics.SurfaceGridDistanceMeasure.Pythagorean
member.summary: Represents slowest but most accurate measure of distance using Pythagorean term. Same as measuring distance while flying over city blocks

member.param: begin color, corresponding to p=0.0
interpolation parameter assumed to be in [0.0, 1.0]
end color, corresponding to p=1.0
Interpolation mode to use.
member.returns: new color corresponding to the specified interpolation parameter
member.remarks: There are always two interpolation paths for the hue, and this function chooses the shortest one, so for example an interpolation from red to blue runs through purple, not orange, yellow and green.

member.name: M:Infragistics.ColorUtil.GetAHSVInterpolation(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: Get an interpolated color between two colors.
member.param: begin color, corresponding to p=0.0
interpolation parameter assumed to be in [0.0, 1.0]
end color, corresponding to p=1.0
member.returns: new color corresponding to the specified interpolation parameter
member.remarks: There are always two interpolation paths for the hue, and this function chooses the shortest one, so for example an interpolation from red to blue runs through purple, not orange, yellow and green.

member.summary: Gets a color from the specified ahsl components
member.param: The alpha (transparency), expressed as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is transparent and 1 is opaque.
The hue (color), expressed as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is red, 1 is also red, and in between are orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet.
The saturation (colorfulness), expressed as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is gray and 1 is fully saturated/colorful.
The lightness, expressed as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is black and 1 is white.

member.name: T:Infragistics.DataMapping
member.summary: Defines a mapping between database and internal property names.
member.remarks:
Datamappings allow specification of one-to-one and one-to-many property name mappings.
Typically, unrefererenced internal properties will not be assigned to and unreferenced external properties will be ignored. It is often valid to assign to arbitrary internal property ("custom") names, although this is not functionality implemented by the DataMapping class, which simply provides the mapping mechanism.

member.summary: Converts instances of other types to and from a DataMapping.
member.remarks: The only conversion type supported by DataMapping.Converter is to and from string.

member.name: T:Infragistics.InteractionHelper
member.summary: The InteractionHelper provides controls with support for all of the common interactions like mouse movement, mouse clicks, key presses, etc., and also incorporates proper event semantics when the control is disabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInMilliseconds
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.summary: Gets or sets the last time the control was clicked.

member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.
member.param: Control receiving interaction.

member.name: M:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.

member.summary: Utility class for polygon simpliciation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.PolySimplification.VertexReduction(System.Tuple{System.Double[],System.Double[]},System.Double)
member.summary:
Simple vertex reduction algorithm. Complexity: O(n)
Summary: Include P0 in the result, and set R = P0. Iterate through subsequent points P1,P2,... until distance(PN, R) > tolerance. Include PN in the result, and set R = PN. Continue iterating in this fashion until there are no more points to consider for inclusion.
member.param: Input list of points
The minimum distance allowed between adjacent points
member.returns: List of accepted points

member.name: M:Infragistics.PolySimplification.SquareDistance(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Returns the square of the distance between p1 and p2.

member.name: T:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable
member.summary: Interface for objects placed by a smart placer object.
member.remarks: Although there is a clear intent to SmartPosition values, implementing classes are free to interpret the values as they wish. The only restriction being that the position parameter be interpreted coherently: the bounds set by calling SetPosition() should be identical to those returned by calling GetPosition()

member.name: M:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartPositions
member.summary:
Gets an array of valid positions for the current object. Objects can individually place restrictions on where they can be placed, although in reality it's more likely that they'll just return a static array.
The order of the valid positions has some significance, in that although the placer will choose the best overall position, it will stop searching as soon as it finds an ideal one. The upshot of all of this is that you should return an array sorted in order of preferred placement.
member.returns: Array of valid smart positions for the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartBounds(Infragistics.SmartPosition)
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the current object if it were placed at the specified position.
member.param: Smart position for bounds.
member.returns: Bounds for the current object

member.name: P:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.SmartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the current object.
member.remarks: After the smart position is set, the current object's bounds are assumed to be that returned from GetSmartBounds() if called with the same position.

member.name: P:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.Opacity
member.summary: Sets or gets the opacity of the current object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.SmartPlacer
member.summary: Manages the position for each object in a set of managed SmartPositions in an attempt to minimise overlap.
member.remarks: Collision avoidance uses a greedy algorithm running in O(n^2) with O(n) storage. Although there are no known algorithms running in less time than this, simulated annealing may produce slightly better results with comparable execution time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new SmartPlacer with the default configuration.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Bounds
member.summary: Sets or gets the placement bounds for this smart placer. Setting the placement bounds has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Overlap
member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum permissible placed overlap expressed as a percentage [0, 1] of each placeable's area. Setting the placement overlap has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Fade
member.summary: Sets or gets the fade exponent for ISmartPlaceables which exceed the current overlap. Setting the placement fade has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Place(Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable)
member.summary:
Place the object with respect to currently placed object. Calling this method causes the object to be immediately updated, but has no effect on previously placed objects.
Placeables which cannot be placed within the placement bounds or without overlapping previously placed objects are hidden
member.param: Object to place.
